nodes.bodyText: This should already be included in the backend error message. In what scenario would the SDK be generating this message?

There are some instances in AddressResolver code peice which throw NotFound exceptions with this message.
Also reading the TSG indicates that this can be thrown by SDK code : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/troubleshoot-not-found
Please create a new link and page java request timeouts. This link should only be returned by the service request timeouts.

Not sure if I understand this correctly, please help here.
On reading this TSG : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/troubleshoot-dot-net-sdk-request-timeout, it seems that this link should not only be returned from service, as requestTimeout happens on client side as well, and we throw error using this message. The TSG clearly describes the requestTimeout API on the client side.

This link should be returned by the service: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/troubleshoot-request-timeout
This link should be returned by the .NET SDK: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/troubleshoot-dot-net-sdk-request-timeout

So Java SDK should have a new page just for it's client side generated request timeouts. If it is a timeout from the service then the Java SDK shouldn't need to add anything because it will already have the link.
